timeline.bodyText:
According to the Java Servlet specification, the config WebServerConfig.WEBSERVER_API_URLPREFIX_CONFIG must end with /* suffix.

The following comment seems incomplete:


  
    
      cruise-control/config/cruisecontrol.properties
    
    
        Lines 325 to 327
      in
      5ed774e
    
    
    
    

        
          
           # REST API default prefix 
        

        
          
           # (dont forget the ending *) 
        

        
          
           webserver.api.urlprefix=/kafkacruisecontrol/* 
        
    
  


Can we update it to say:
# REST API default prefix (dont forget the ending /*)


We don't have any sanity check to enforce this suffix upon configuration time. Can we add a sanity check for WEBSERVER_API_URLPREFIX_CONFIG under KafkaCruiseControlConfig?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
apiUrlPrefix must end with /* -- i.e. failure of this condition must result in a configuration time failure.
Hence, this if check is redundant.

replies.bodyText: Don't we have sanity checks in KafkaCruiseControlConfig.java to ensure validity of config values in production regardless of whether they are the default ones or overridden by users?
replies.author: efeg

replies.bodyText: Yes, the sanity checks will catch invalid web server URL prefix. However, invalid URL prefix can only be caught during runtime whereas this test fails the build process if the default webserver URL is invalid.
replies.author: Lincong

replies.bodyText:
The existing unit tests already verify (as they should) the behavior of the tested unit with all possible good and bad inputs. The default value is just one such input, whose behavior is known -- because we already tested what such an input would generate. We know that if a future programmer changes the default value, CC will fail to start and provide a meaningful message to help resolve the configuration issue, because it is tested.
I am against adding individual tests specifically for the default values as it eventually leads to bloating, making a build take longer at CircleCI with no additional testing coverage.

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure if extending an abstract class like this by SecurityAndSslConfigTest and WebserverUrlPrefixConfigTest is the best approach.

SecurityAndSslConfigTest does not use GET_CLASS_METHOD_NAME anywhere, and
WebserverUrlPrefixConfigTest does not use GET_BOOLEAN_METHOD_NAME and HASH_CODE_METHOD_NAME anywhere.

Inheritance should imply that everything in the abstract class applies to the classes that extend from it. If the goal here is to share common constants across classes, can we move these constants to a utility class within config package?
